data.description: In-person | Houston, TX | Spring Internship Johnson Law Group is a fast growing plaintiffs’ law firm with a national presence and more than 20 years of experience advocating for individuals and families. Headquartered in Houston, Texas, we represent clients across a wide range of practice areas including personal injury, mass tort, workers’ compensation, and complex litigation. We are proud of our track record of securing meaningful results, including over $1 billion in verdicts and settlements to date. Our teams combine legal expertise with technology, data, and cross-functional collaboration to support informed decision making and high-impact outcomes. Our culture is rooted in integrity, curiosity, and accountability. We strive to create an environment where people are empowered to grow, contribute, and do meaningful work every day. About the Role We're seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Data Analyst Intern to join us for Spring 2026. This is a great opportunity for a student with strong analytical skills to contribute to real-time projects that drive decision-making across departments including Legal, Operations, Finance, and Marketing. What You'll Do Assist in collecting, cleaning, and transforming data from multiple internal systems (e.g., CRM, case management tools) Support cross-functional teams by translating business questions into technical data queries Maintain and optimize dashboards to track performance, outcomes, and operational trends Contribute to the development and testing of data automation scripts and reporting pipelines Help ensure data accuracy through routine validation and quality checks Collaborate with stakeholders on ad-hoc reporting needs and documentation What We’re Looking For Currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Data Science) Exposure to SQL, Python, and Snowflake for data querying and analysis Familiarity with Excel and data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI Comfortable working with large datasets and performing quality assurance Effective communicator who is curious, organized, and eager to learn in a collaborative environment Preferred but Not Required Experience with Salesforce or similar CRM systems Exposure to data preparation tools (e.g., Tableau Prep, Alteryx) or RPA platforms like UiPath Interest in text analysis or natural language processing tools
requirements: Currently pursuing a bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Data Science)
Experience with Salesforce or similar CRM systems
